did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Rockville Journal World War II Letters
did.abstract: The collection contains letters, postcards, photographs, newsletters and mailing address information sent by local men and women in service during World War II to Stephen Von Euw, editor of The Rockville Journal in Rockville, Connecticut.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Vernon Historical Society.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], , [Box no]., Vernon Historical Society

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Ruth Von Euw, daughter of Stephen Von Euw left the collection of letters to the Vernon Historical Society upon her death in 2008.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Stephen Von Euw (1896-1955) was the editor of The Rockville Journal from the 1930s until his death. During World War II, Mr. Von Euw made sure that local servicemen and servicewomen received free copies of the paper wherever they were stationed. Many sent letters, postcards or other materials thanking him for giving them a link to home. Some shared their experiences whether stateside or on the front lines. Mr. Euw saved a letter from the government asking newspaper editors to collect materials from the War for posterity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of folders for each military correspondent arranged alphabetically. With each folder, items are arranged chronologically. The amount of correspondence from each person varies. Those who knew Mr. Von Euw personally tended to write more. Some people only sent change of address forms as they moved from training to active duty. Photographs in the folders range from family pictures to portraits in uniform to snapshots in service to military publicity shots. Postcards show scenes from places in the US that were near training areas or pictures of base or airfields. Some postcards have scenes from overseas. A few postcards have cartoons depicting military life. Some soldiers sent newsletters from their units.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection of over 700 folders is stored in a five drawer file cabinet. The folders are alphabetically arranged. Materials with each folder are in chronological order.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: World War, 1939-1945- Connecticut- Rockville
World War, 1939-1945- Connecticut- Vernon
Photographs
Postcards
Military Newsletters

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: One box with 13 folders that contains materials and correspondence to and from Stephen Von Euw during World War II.
